member.name: IAMCrossbar.CanRoute

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The CanRoute method queries whether a specified input pin can be routed to a specified output pin.

member.param: Specifies the index of the output pin.
Specifies the index of input pin.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT values. Possible values include the following.

listheader.description: These two pins can be routed.
These two pins cannot be routed.

member.name: IAMCrossbar.get_CrossbarPinInfo

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The get_CrossbarPinInfo method retrieves information about a specified pin.

param.name: IsInputPin
param.para: Specifies the direction of the pin. Use one of the following values.

member.param: Specifies the index of the pin.

Pointer to a variable that receives the index of the related pin, or –1 if no pin is related to this pin. The related pin is a pin on the same filter, with the same direction; it typically represents the same physical jack or connector. For example, a video tuner and an audio tuner might be related pins. Typically, if two pins are related, you should route them together.
Pointer to a variable that receives a member of the enumeration, indicating the pin's physical type.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IAMCrossbar.get_IsRoutedTo

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The get_IsRoutedTo method retrieves the input pin that is currently routed to the specified output pin.

member.param: Specifies the index of the output pin.
Pointer to a variable that receives the index of the input pin, or -1 if no input pin is routed to this output pin.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

listheader.description: No input pin is routed to this output pin.

member.name: IAMCrossbar.get_PinCounts

Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The get_PinCounts method retrieves the number of input and output pins on the crossbar filter.

member.param: Pointer to variable that receives the number of output pins.
Pointer to variable that receives the number of input pins.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IAMCrossbar.Route

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . The Route method routes an input pin to an output pin.

member.param: Specifies the index of the output pin.
Specifies the index of the input pin.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The IAMCrossbar interface routes signals from an analog or digital source to a video capture filter.

This interface is implemented by the Analog Video Crossbar Filter. The Analog Video Crossbar filter is modeled after a general switching matrix, with n inputs and m outputs. For example, a video card might have two external connectors: a coaxial connector for TV, and an S-video input. These would be represented as input pins on the filter. To select one of the inputs, an application would use the IAMCrossbar interface to "route" an input pin to the filter's output pin, by calling the method.
